register.name: DBGAUTHSTATUS_EL1
register.description: Provides information about the state of the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED authentication interface for debug.

bitField.name: SNID
bitField.description: Secure non-invasive debug.

bitField.name: SID
bitField.description: Secure invasive debug.

bitField.name: NSNID
bitField.description: Non-secure non-invasive debug.

bitField.name: NSID
bitField.description: Non-secure invasive debug.

register.name: DBGBCR0_EL1
register.description: Holds control information for a breakpoint. Forms breakpoint n together with value register DBGBVR<n>_EL1.

bitField.name: BT
bitField.description: Breakpoint Type.

bitField.name: LBN
bitField.description: Linked breakpoint number. For Linked address matching breakpoints, this specifies the index of the Context-matching breakpoint linked to.

bitField.name: SSC
bitField.description: Security state control. Determines the Security states under which a Breakpoint debug event for breakpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the HMC and PMC fields, and there are constraints on the permitted values of the {HMC, SSC, PMC} fields. For more information, including the effect of programming the fields to a reserved set of values, see .

bitField.name: HMC
bitField.description: Higher mode control. Determines the debug perspective for deciding when a Breakpoint debug event for breakpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the SSC and PMC fields, and there are constraints on the permitted values of the {HMC, SSC, PMC} fields. For more information see the SSC, bits [15:14] description.

bitField.name: BAS
bitField.description: Byte address select. Defines which half-words an address-matching breakpoint matches, regardless of the instruction set and Execution state. In an AArch64-only implementation, this field is reserved, RES1.

bitField.name: PMC
bitField.description: Privilege mode control. Determines the Exception level or levels at which a Breakpoint debug event for breakpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the SSC and HMC fields, and there are constraints on the permitted values of the {HMC, SSC, PMC} fields. For more information see the DBGBCR<n>_EL1.SSC description.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Enable breakpoint DBGBVR<n>_EL1.

register.name: DBGCLAIMCLR_EL1
register.description: Used by software to read the values of the CLAIM tag bits, and to clear these bits to 0...

bitField.name: CLAIM
bitField.description: Read or clear CLAIM tag bits. Reading this field returns the current value of the CLAIM tag bits.

register.name: DBGCLAIMSET_EL1
register.description: Used by software to set the CLAIM tag bits to 1...

bitField.name: CLAIM
bitField.description: Set CLAIM tag bits. RAO.

register.name: DBGPRCR_EL1
register.description: Controls behavior of the PE on powerdown request.

bitField.name: CORENPDRQ
bitField.description: Core no powerdown request. Requests emulation of powerdown.

register.name: DBGVCR32_EL2
register.description: Allows access to the AArch32 register DBGVCR from AArch64 state only. Its value has no effect on execution in AArch64 state.

register.name: DBGWCR0_EL1
register.description: Holds control information for a watchpoint. Forms watchpoint n together with value register DBGWVR<n>_EL1.

bitField.name: MASK
bitField.description: Address mask. Only objects up to 2GB can be watched using a single mask.

bitField.name: WT
bitField.description: Watchpoint type.

bitField.name: LBN
bitField.description: Linked breakpoint number. For Linked data address watchpoints, this specifies the index of the Context-matching breakpoint linked to.

bitField.name: SSC
bitField.description: Security state control. Determines the Security states under which a Watchpoint debug event for watchpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the HMC and PAC fields.

bitField.name: HMC
bitField.description: Higher mode control. Determines the debug perspective for deciding when a Watchpoint debug event for watchpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the SSC and PAC fields.

bitField.name: BAS
bitField.description: Byte address select. Each bit of this field selects whether a byte from within the word or double-word addressed by DBGWVR<n>_EL1 is being watched.

bitField.name: LSC
bitField.description: Load/store control. This field enables watchpoint matching on the type of access being made.

bitField.name: PAC
bitField.description: Privilege of access control. Determines the Exception level or levels at which a Watchpoint debug event for watchpoint n is generated. This field must be interpreted along with the SSC and HMC fields.

bitField.name: E
bitField.description: Enable watchpoint n.

register.name: DBGWVR0_EL1
register.description: Holds a data address value for use in watchpoint matching. Forms watchpoint n together with control register DBGWCR<n>_EL1.

bitField.name: RESS
bitField.description: Reserved, Sign extended. Hardware and software must treat this field as RES0 if the most significant bit of VA is 0 or RES0, and as RES1 if the most significant bit of VA is 1.

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Bits[48:2] of the address value for comparison.

bitField.name: RESS
bitField.description: Reserved, Sign extended. Hardware and software must treat this field as RES0 if the most significant bit of VA is 0 or RES0, and as RES1 if the most significant bit of VA is 1.

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Bits[48:2] of the address value for comparison.

register.name: MDCCINT_EL1
register.description: Enables interrupt requests to be signaled based on the DCC status flags.

bitField.name: RX
bitField.description: DCC interrupt request enable control for DTRRX. Enables a common COMMIRQ interrupt request to be signaled based on the DCC status flags.

bitField.name: TX
bitField.description: DCC interrupt request enable control for DTRTX. Enables a common COMMIRQ interrupt request to be signaled based on the DCC status flags.

register.name: MDCCSR_EL0
register.description: Main control register for the debug implementation, containing flow-control flags for the DCC. This is an internal, read-only view.

bitField.name: RXfull
bitField.description: DTRRX full. Read-only view of the equivalent bit in the EDSCR.

bitField.name: TXfull
bitField.description: DTRTX full. Read-only view of the equivalent bit in the EDSCR.

register.name: MDCR_EL2
register.description: Provides EL2 configuration options for self-hosted debug and the Performance Monitors Extension.

bitField.name: HPMD
bitField.description: Guest Performance Monitors Disable. This control prohibits event counting at EL2.

bitField.name: TDRA
bitField.description: Trap Debug ROM Address register access. Traps Non-secure System register accesses to the Debug ROM registers to EL2.

bitField.name: TDOSA
bitField.description: Trap debug OS-related register access.

bitField.name: TDA
bitField.description: Trap Debug Access.

bitField.name: TDE
bitField.description: Trap Debug exceptions.

bitField.name: HPME
bitField.description: Hypervisor Performance Monitors Counters Enable.

bitField.name: TPM
bitField.description: Trap Performance Monitors accesses.

bitField.name: TPMCR
bitField.description: Trap PMCR_EL0 or PMCR accesses. Traps Non-secure EL0 and EL1 accesses to the PMCR_EL0 or PMCR to EL2.

bitField.name: HPMN
bitField.description: Defines the number of Performance Monitors counters that are accessible from Non-secure EL0 and EL1 modes.

register.name: MDCR_EL3
register.description: Provides EL3 configuration options for self-hosted debug and the Performance Monitors Extension.

bitField.name: EPMAD
bitField.description: External debug interface Performance Monitors registers disable.

bitField.name: EDAD
bitField.description: External debug interface breakpoint and watchpoint register access disable.

bitField.name: SPME
bitField.description: Secure Performance Monitors enable.

bitField.name: SDD
bitField.description: AArch64 Secure self-hosted invasive debug disable. Disables Software debug exceptions in Secure state, other than Breakpoint Instruction exceptions.

bitField.name: SPD32
bitField.description: AArch32 Secure self-hosted privileged invasive debug control. Enables or disables debug exceptions from Secure EL1 using AArch32, other than Breakpoint Instruction exceptions.

bitField.name: TDOSA
bitField.description: Trap debug OS-related register access.

bitField.name: TDA
bitField.description: Trap Debug Access. Traps EL2, EL1, and EL0 System register accesses to those debug System registers that cannot be trapped using the MDCR_EL3.TDOSA field. When MDCR_EL3.

bitField.name: TPM
bitField.description: Trap Performance Monitors accesses. Traps EL2, EL1, and EL0 accesses to all Performance Monitors registers to EL3, from both Security states and both Execution states.

register.name: MDRAR_EL1
register.description: Defines the base physical address of a 4KB-aligned memory-mapped debug component, usually a ROM table that locates and describes the memory-mapped debug components in the system. ARMv8 deprecates any use of this register.

bitField.name: ROMADDR_47_12
bitField.description: Bits[47:12] of the ROM table physical address.

bitField.name: Valid
bitField.description: This field indicates whether the ROM Table address is valid.

register.name: MDSCR_EL1
register.description: Main control register for the debug implementation.

bitField.name: RXfull
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.RXfull.

bitField.name: TXfull
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.TXfull.

bitField.name: RXO
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.RXO.

bitField.name: TXU
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.TXU.

bitField.name: INTdis
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.INTdis.

bitField.name: TDA
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.TDA.

bitField.name: SC2
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.SC2.

bitField.name: MDE
bitField.description: Monitor debug events. Enable Breakpoint, Watchpoint, and Vector Catch exceptions.

bitField.name: HDE
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.HDE.

bitField.name: KDE
bitField.description: Local (kernel) debug enable. If ELD is using AArch64, enable debug exceptions within ELD.

bitField.name: TDCC
bitField.description: Traps EL0 accesses to the DCC registers to EL1, from both Execution states:

bitField.name: ERR
bitField.description: Used for save/restore of EDSCR.ERR.

bitField.name: SS
bitField.description: Software step control bit. If ELD is using AArch64, enable Software step.

register.name: OSDLR_EL1
register.description: Used to control the OS Double Lock.

bitField.name: DLK
bitField.description: OS Double Lock control bit.

register.name: OSDTRRX_EL1
register.gui_name: OS Lock Data Transfer Register, Receive
register.description: Used for save/restore of DBGDTRRX_EL0. It is a component of the Debug Communications Channel.

register.name: OSDTRTX_EL1
register.gui_name: OS Lock Data Transfer Register, Transmit
register.description: Used for save/restore of DBGDTRTX_EL0. It is a component of the Debug Communications Channel.

register.name: OSECCR_EL1
register.gui_name: OS Lock Exception Catch Control Register
register.description: Provides a mechanism for an operating system to access the contents of EDECCR that are otherwise invisible to software, so it can save/restore the contents of EDECCR over powerdown on behalf of the external debugger.

bitField.name: EDECCR
bitField.description: Used for save/restore to EDECCR over powerdown.

register.name: OSLAR_EL1
register.description: Used to lock or unlock the OS lock.

bitField.name: OSLK
bitField.description: On writes to OSLAR_EL1, bit[0] is copied to the OS lock.

register.name: OSLSR_EL1
register.description: Provides the status of the OS lock.

bitField.name: OSLM_1
bitField.description: See below for description of the OSLM field.

bitField.name: nTT
bitField.description: Not 32-bit access. This bit is always RAZ. It indicates that a 32-bit access is needed to write the key to the OS Lock Access Register.

bitField.name: OSLK
bitField.description: OS Lock Status.

bitField.name: OSLM_0
bitField.description: OS lock model implemented. Identifies the form of OS save and restore mechanism implemented.

register.name: SDER32_EL3
register.description: Allows access to the AArch32 register SDER from AArch64 state only. Its value has no effect on execution in AArch64 state.

bitField.name: SUNIDEN
bitField.description: Secure User Non-Invasive Debug Enable:

bitField.name: SUIDEN
bitField.description: Secure User Invasive Debug Enable:

tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_privileged_debug_disabled
